properties.comment: Linked data queries for global queries
properties.entry: art17delv2012s euringcodes estatcodes n2000habitats syntaxa art172013crh art172013crs
Natura 2000 codelist of Annex I habitats (SDF field: 3.1)

Codelist for habitat types under Directive 2009/147/EC. These are the codes used in the Natura 2000 standard data form (SDF) and in the Article 17 reporting. Please note there is a table in the Natura 2000 reference portal that includes the Annex I habitat types codes and the names in several languages.

SELECT CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/habitats/', CONVERT(ID_HABITAT USING utf8)) AS FACTSHEET, CODE_2000, IF(PRIORITY=1,'*',NULL) AS PRIORITY, SCIENTIFIC_NAME FROM chm62edt_habitat WHERE CODE_2000 IS NOT NULL ORDER BY CODE_2000
Natura 2000 codelist for bird species (SDF fields 3.2, 3.3)

Code list for bird species under Directive 2009/147/EC (codified version of Directive 79/409/EEC). These are the codes used in the Natura 2000 standard data form (SDF) and in the Article 12 reporting. Please note there is a table in the Natura 2000 reference portal that includes the code lists for birds and e.g. more information about presence/absence in the annexes.

SELECT a.OBJECT AS N2000CODE, CONCAT('http://dd.eionet.europa.eu/vocabulary/biodiversity/n2000birds/', a.OBJECT) AS N2000URL, SCIENTIFIC_NAME, AUTHOR, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(ID_SPECIES USING utf8)) AS FACTSHEET, c.OBJECT AS COMMENT FROM chm62edt_species AS s JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS a ON s.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=a.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND a.NAME="sameSynonymN2000" LEFT JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS c ON s.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=c.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND c.NAME="_n2000CodeComment" WHERE ID_GROUP_SPECIES=5 ORDER BY a.OBJECT
Natura 2000 codelist for species (Annex II,IV,V) (SDF fields 3.2, 3.3)

Code list for species under Directive 92/42/EEC. These are the codes used in the Natura 2000 standard data form (SDF) and in the Article 17 reporting. Please note there is a table in the Natura 2000 reference portal that includes the code lists for species and e.g. more information about alternative names and presence/absence in the annexes.

SELECT a.OBJECT AS N2000CODE, CONCAT('http://dd.eionet.europa.eu/vocabulary/biodiversity/n2000species/', a.OBJECT) AS N2000URL, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, s.AUTHOR, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES USING utf8)) AS FACTSHEET, IF(s.ID_SPECIES != s.ID_SPECIES_LINK, v.SCIENTIFIC_NAME,NULL) AS VALID_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES != s.ID_SPECIES_LINK, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(v.ID_SPECIES USING utf8)),NULL) AS VALIDLINK, CASE WHEN a.OBJECT = c.OBJECT THEN NULL WHEN c.OBJECT IS NULL THEN 'NO CODE' ELSE c.OBJECT END AS VALCODE FROM chm62edt_species AS s JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS a ON s.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=a.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND a.NAME="sameSynonymN2000" JOIN chm62edt_species AS v ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK = v.ID_SPECIES LEFT JOIN chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS c ON v.ID_NATURE_OBJECT=c.ID_NATURE_OBJECT AND c.NAME="sameSynonymN2000" WHERE s.ID_GROUP_SPECIES<>5 ORDER BY a.OBJECT
Vegetation syntaxa crosswalks to EUNIS habitat classification (Schaminée et al, 2012)
Schaminée, J.H.J., Chytrý, M., Hennekens, S.M., Mucina, L., Rodwell, J.S. & Tichý, L. (2012): Development of vegetation syntaxa crosswalks to EUNIS habitat classification and related data sets

The crosswalks are cross-references between widely accepted European habitats (i.e. the EUNIS habitats classification) and phytosociological definitions of vegetation types (i.e. syntaxa). Source: Schaminée, J.H.J., Chytrý, M., Hennekens, S.M., Mucina, L., Rodwell, J.S. & Tichý, L. (2012): Development of vegetation syntaxa crosswalks to EUNIS habitat classification and related data sets.
This is a list of NUTS codes queried as external data from EEA's Semantic Data Service.
Eurostat fishes code list with EUNIS species matches

The Eurostat code list is primarily used for fishery statistics. The 3-alpha identifier is a unique code made of three letters that is widely used for the exchange of data with national correspondents and among fishery agencies.
EURING bird species list (subset) with EUNIS species match

This is a list of EURING codes for the bird species that are known in EUNIS - It is not the complete EURING list. To get the EURING code list visit http://blx1.bto.org/euringcodes/species.jsp or the Euring home page.

SELECT OBJECT AS code, SCIENTIFIC_NAME, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(ID_SPECIES USING utf8)) AS URL FROM chm62edt_nature_object_attributes JOIN chm62edt_species USING(ID_NATURE_OBJECT) WHERE NAME="sameSynonymEURING" ORDER BY OBJECT
Species object of derogations under the Birds and the Habitats Directives

Species object of derogations under the Birds Directive Article 9 and the Habitats Directive Article 16. The Member States mentioned are only those which used the electronic reporting of derogations (HABIDES). Derogations may have been granted by other Member States.
Conservation status reports (2007-2012) of species and habitat types (Habitats Directive, Article 17)

Assessments on the conservation status of the habitat types and species of Community interest have been carried out in EU 27 for the period 2007-2012, compiled as part of the Habitats Directive - Article 17 reporting process. The table lists the species for which there were reports made.
Annex II: animal and plant species of community interest whose conservation requires the designation of special areas of conservation.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, t.NAME AS FAMILY, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES USING utf8)) AS URL, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK USING utf8)), NULL ) AS VALID_URL, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, p.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, NULL) AS VALID_NAME FROM chm62edt_reports AS r JOIN chm62edt_report_type USING (ID_REPORT_TYPE) JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING (ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) JOIN chm62edt_species AS p ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK=p.ID_SPECIES LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE LOOKUP_TYPE='LEGAL_STATUS' AND r.ID_DC IN (1554, 1823, 2325) ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
Annex IV: animal and plant species of community interest in need of strict protection.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES USING utf8)) AS URL, t.NAME AS FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK USING utf8)), NULL ) AS VALID_URL, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, p.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, NULL) AS VALID_NAME FROM chm62edt_reports AS r JOIN chm62edt_report_type USING (ID_REPORT_TYPE) JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING (ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) JOIN chm62edt_species AS p ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK=p.ID_SPECIES LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE LOOKUP_TYPE='LEGAL_STATUS' AND r.ID_DC IN (1555, 1824, 2326) ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
Annex V: animal and plant species of community interest whose taking in the wild and exploitation may be subject to management measures.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, t.NAME AS FAMILY, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES USING utf8)) AS URL, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK USING utf8)), NULL ) AS VALID_URL, IF(s.ID_SPECIES_LINK != s.ID_SPECIES, p.SCIENTIFIC_NAME, NULL) AS VALID_NAME FROM chm62edt_reports AS r JOIN chm62edt_report_type USING (ID_REPORT_TYPE) JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING (ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) JOIN chm62edt_species AS p ON s.ID_SPECIES_LINK=p.ID_SPECIES LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE LOOKUP_TYPE='LEGAL_STATUS' AND r.ID_DC IN (1556, 1825, 2327) ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
Invasive species according to the Global Invasive Species Database
Some of the species in EUNIS are registered as invasive in the Global Invasive Species Database (GISD). This is a list of them. Note that EUNIS does not have information on all the invasive species.

SELECT g.COMMON_NAME AS SPECIES_GROUP, t.NAME AS FAMILY, CONCAT('[CONTEXT_PATH]/species/', CONVERT(s.ID_SPECIES USING utf8)) AS URL, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME FROM chm62edt_nature_object_attributes AS a JOIN chm62edt_species AS s USING(ID_NATURE_OBJECT) JOIN chm62edt_group_species AS g USING(ID_GROUP_SPECIES) LEFT JOIN chm62edt_taxonomy AS t ON s.ID_TAXONOMY=t.ID_TAXONOMY AND t.LEVEL='Family' WHERE a.NAME="sameSynonymISSG" ORDER BY SPECIES_GROUP, FAMILY, s.SCIENTIFIC_NAME
Test for Jasper Reports integration using SPARQL data source and no pagination
Jasper Reports SPARQL integration test paginated
Test for Jasper Reports integration using SPARQL data source and pagination
Test for Jasper Reports integration using SQL data source and no pagination
Jasper Reports SQL integration test paginated
Test for Jasper Reports integration using SQL data source and pagination
Test for Jasper Reports integration using a subreport and combining SQL with SPARQL
Conservation status (2007-2012) of habitat types (Habitats Directive, Article 17)

Country-level assessment of the conservation status of habitat types by country and biogeographical region. All EU Member States are requested by the Habitats Directive (1992) to monitor habitat types and species considered to be of Community interest.
Conservation status (2007-2012) of species (Habitats Directive, Article 17)

Country-level assessment of the conservation status of species by country and biogeographical region. All EU Member States are requested by the Habitats Directive (1992) to monitor habitat types and species considered to be of Community interest.
